QuestionStatement: Economic growth is best defined as
AnswerChoices: A reduction in the infant mortality rate
A decrease in the unemployment rate
An increase in the labor force participation rate
A short-run increase in gross domestic product without inflation
A sustained increase in real gross domestic product per capita

QuestionStatement: The price of one nation’s currency expressed in terms of another nation’s currency is called
AnswerChoices: The world price
The exchange rate
The law of one price
Terms of trade
purchasing power parity

QuestionStatement: Using equal amounts of labor hours, Country X and Country Y can each produce the number of watches and radios shown in the production possibilities curve above.  Based on the information, which of the following is true?
AnswerChoices: Country X has an absolute advantage in the production of both watches and radios and a comparative advantage in the production of watches
Country Y has an absolute advantage in the production of both watches and radios and a comparative advantage in the production of radios
Countries X and Y can engage in a mutually advantageous trade by exchanging 1 watch for 1 radio
Country Y is willing to give up 2 watches in exchange for 1 radio from Country X
Country X is willing to give up 2 radios in exchange for 1 watch from Country Y

QuestionStatement: If a worker’s nominal wage rate increases from $10 to $12 per hour and at the same time the general price level increases by 10 percent, the worker’s real wage has
AnswerChoices: Approximately decreased by 10%
Approximately decreased by 20%
Approximately increased by 10%
Approximately increased by 20%
Not changed

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is an example of fiscal policy?
AnswerChoices: Increasing government expenditures to build highways
Increasing the money supply to increase income
Decreasing the discount rate to lower unemployment and inflation
Decreasing the federal funds rate to stimulate investment
Decreasing the reserve ratio to increase bank reserves

QuestionStatement: The Federal Reserve can cause an increase in interest rates in an attempt to
AnswerChoices: Reduce inflation
Reduce cyclical unemployment
Reduce structural unemployment
Increase aggregate demand
Increase investment spending

QuestionStatement: The value of which of the following is counted in the United States gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: Clean air
Child care a father provides for his child
An automobile produced in Sweden by a United States firm
A car produced in the United States and sold to Europe
Medical services not provided due to preventative healthcare

QuestionStatement: Aggregate demand may be measured by adding
AnswerChoices: Consumption, investment, savings, and imports
Savings, government spending, and business inventories
Consumption, investment, government spending, and net exports
Domestic private expenditures and government spending
Domestic expenditures and imports

QuestionStatement: According to the short-run Phillips curve, a decrease in unemployment is expected to be accompanied by
AnswerChoices: Higher labor force participation
An increase in inflation
An increase in the productivity of capital
An increase in the government deficit
A decrease in real gross domestic product

QuestionStatement: If labor costs rise in the automobile industry, which of the following will happen to car prices and the quantity of cars sold?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: The annual inflation rate is expected to be 5 percent over the next 3 years.  Juan plans to take out a 3 year loan to purchase an automobile.  If Juan decides not to take out the loan if the real interest rate exceeds 3 percent, the highest nominal interest rate he is willing to pay is
AnswerChoices: 2 percent
3 percent
8 percent
15 percent
25 percent

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true about the national debt of the United States?
AnswerChoices: It is the debt owed to foreign investors
It is the accumulation of past and current budget deficits and surpluses
It increases when gross domestic product increases
It increases when exports decrease, and decreases when exports increase
It did not exist before 1980

QuestionStatement: Which of the following most undermines the ability of a nation’s currency to store value?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the purchasing power of the currency
The use of credit and debit cards as mediums of exchange
An increase in the prices of federal bonds
Appreciation of the currency in the international money market
An increase in the supply of foreign currencies in the international money market

QuestionStatement: Assume that the inflation rate in Country X is very high relative to the inflation rates in all of its trading partners.  Which of the following is likely to happen to Country X’s currency on the foreign exchange market?
AnswerChoices: The demand curve for the currency will shift to the right, and the currency will appreciate
The demand curve for the currency will shift to the left, and the currency will depreciate
The supply curve for the currency will shift to the left, and the currency will appreciate
The supply curve for the currency will shift to the left, and the currency will depreciate
There will be no shift in the demand curve for the currency, but the currency will depreciate

QuestionStatement: Comparative advantage implies that
AnswerChoices: No country should specialize completely in the production of any one good
Every country should try to export more than it imports
Developing countries should import raw materials and export manufactured goods
Two countries should benefit from trade unless both have equal opportunity costs in every good
Countries should impose tariffs to protect their domestic industries

QuestionStatement: If the velocity of money is stable, the quantity theory of money predicts that an increase in the money supply will lead to a proportional
AnswerChoices: Increase in the nominal output
Decrease in the price level
Decrease in the nominal interest rate
Decrease in the real interest rate
Decrease in the unemployment rate

QuestionStatement: The diagram below shows a linear production possibilities curve for a country.If the economy is currently producing 10 units of good A and 90 units of good B, the opportunity cost of increasing the production of good A from 10 units to 20 units is how many units of good B?
Not scored
AnswerChoices: a
a

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is most likely to occur when the Federal Reserve buys government bonds on the open market?
AnswerChoices: The demand for money will decrease
The government’s debt will decrease
Interest rates will decrease
The discount rate will increase
Investment demand will decrease

QuestionStatement: An industry historically used employees with specific skills.  If this industry experiences technological advances that require new skills, there will most likely be
AnswerChoices: Cyclical unemployment
Frictional unemployment
Seasonal unemployment
Structural unemployment
No change in unemployment
